title: Is it too easy to get perma banned?
body:
So about two days ago my account got perma banned after retaliating to hate speech with hate speech of my own. The other player reported me and my account has since been perma banned. It was only the second time ive ever recieved any punishment on the game. My first punishment was a suspension for a inappropriate name that got dealt with rather quickly and this was back in 2015. There hasn’t been a single incident since but instead of getting a warning or a chat ban or anything of the sort I just got flat out perma banned. So back to the question at hand.

Is it too easy to get perma banned?

Also if anyone knows any way I can get it reversed then please let me kno

replies.body:
My researched understanding of the system is that you cannot receive a behavioral permanent ban for a chat offense unless you've already had a 14-day ban, and the 14-day ban must be _somewhat_ recent. You're a somewhat infrequent player, so I can't just point out a 14-day gap in your history and call you a liar. 

If you're being straight with us, you should open a support ticket. Your story, taken at face value, should end with you receiving a 14-day ban and being on your last chance, not a perma.
Ya I’ve never recieved a 14 day ban or a chat restriction of any kind it was just straight to a perma ban

Are you sure it isn't a ban pending another name change? Yours is... amusing, not gonna lie, but also obviously offensive. 

Regardless, let us know how the support ticket goes.
No it’s a perma ban for speech, I’ve sent in two tickets and the first brought me here so let’s see where the second gets me
Well, there's your name change.

It's too easy not to. All you gotta do is:
1. Don't be toxic
2. Don't respond to toxicity
3. Play the game until it ends (don't troll, AFK, or intentionally feed)

And even if you do all 3 of those things consistently in every game you play, it will still take you over a month to be permabanned. If I were in charge of it, trolling and inting would be instant permaban. AFK can be forgivable, but if you were displaying toxicity in chat and it was obvious that you rage quit instead of just having internet problems, you shouldn't get any leniency. Minimum of a 1 month ban, possibly a permaban. If it seems like it could have just been internet problems (and Riot can probably put systems in place to track internet usage on your computer), then it's a bit more forgivable with just some low priority queues. I don't think you should be permanently banned for going AFK because your internet cut out. However, doing so in ranked, even with just internet problems, should be harsher punishment than in normal games.
If I were in charge of it,flaming would only be a chat restriction

Since it's you, I don't doubt it one bit.

There was a time a few seasons ago when it was like that...when CRs stacked. You know what the effect was? Players were collecting CRs like they collect skins now. It wasn t uncommon to know someone who had 2000+ games CRs

Not the best way to handle the problem, don't you think?

(Who am I kidding? Ofc you do...)
Huh? I want chat restrictions because it limits their chat,not makes then not toxic.
if after your chat was limited for 10+25 games you are **still** toxic then any further games while restricted won't make a difference
I know it might not make a difference,but at least they won't be spamming more than a few toxic messages,and they will think more on how they type.

getting banned has that effect too... except it's better

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

>and they will think more on how they type.

you ignored what i said about the time when chat restrictions used to stack, didn't you?
Well getting banned is too harsh of a punishment imo
it wouldn't be much of a punishment if it didn't at the very least sting

My fool proof method to not get banned:

**Don't be a dick**
Don't spread false information. You're going to get people banned when they try that.
Can you come back after checking out my latest morg ranked game?

Anecdotal evidence does not a case make.

If you feel that a player in one of your games inted, submit a support ticket to ensure that it gets manually reviewed.

It catches up to them eventually. Even if the system is slow, it still enforces the rules.
Personal opinions do not make a case either. I have submitted to support multiple times and got the same copy paste each time. None have been banned in 4 years.

Well I wonder if that has anything to do with what you wrote in your tickets....

When people write in demanding that another player get punished, Riot support tunes out, stops paying attention, and stops caring.

When people write in politely asking for a manual review to be made, they are way more likely to listen.

All that aside, suggesting that someone can get away with inting only encourages people to int. It's unethical to even suggest.

It's not personal, "the act of suggesting it is unethical." That doesn't mean that you are an unethical person, it only means that that act is unethical. It's a criticism of the choice to spread such a message, not a criticism of you as a person.

Nope. I told the rioter what they did, asked if that was supposed to be allowed in league, and then asked why the person was still playing after 2-5 weeks.

In other words you were passive-aggressive and combative.

Asking why a person is still playing after x time is the passive aggressive equivalent to demanding that a punishment be given.

I can see why statements such as those would have been ignored.
Considering your name, I don't think you try very hard
try very hard at what exactly

If you haven't had any punishments since your suspension 2-3 years ago (and if you have played consistently since then) then it seems kind of unusual to get a permanent ban.

Your best bet would be to submit a polite support ticket asking why you were escalated straight to perma when you hadn't had any other recent punishments. They might lower the restriction.

Just do your best to be open and polite, that's the most likely way to be listened to by them.

It's actually pretty hard.

Riot takes hate speech very seriously,  it's kind of equivalent to murder in real life, hence the harsh punishment.
Why are you comparing a game with real life? Are you high?
"My account got banned for Hate Speech ;(((( is it too easy to get banned?" You're asking a question with a username like that? Lol, enjoy that ban.
Ya I am a black man so I don’t see any problem with my name I mean I’ve seen way worse
It's not a contest of "who can be worse" and the fact that you yourself are black is neither here nor there...

Either way i feel like perma banning should only be a punishment given to those who either cheat, hack, sell accounts, boost, or any of the latter. I feel like language should only constitute chat restrictions or suspensions of lengthy amounts.

there used to be a time a few seasons ago when that was exactly how it was like: you'd get chat restrictions for chat based toxicity. The problem was that they would stack infinitely. It wasn't uncommon to know somebody chat restricted for 2000+ games. Players would collect them like they collect skins nowadays, which is not a very good way to deal with the issue if you ask me...
